results.title: F for fake = Verites et mensonges
results.creator_credit: Orson Welles, Dominique Antoine, Francois Reichenbach, Janus Film und Fernsehen (Frankfurt), Les Films des l'Apostrophe and Saci Filmes
results.brief_description: Orson Welles stars in and directs this feature/documentary on fake, forgery, art and illusion that well deserves the title, ‘film essay’. As a basis he uses an unfinished documentary (original footage by Francois Reichenbach) on Elmyr de Hory, a noted art forger. Included in Welles’ documentary within a documentary are interviews by Clifford Irving, biographer of de Hory. Welles injects his views on his Hollywood career and artistic originality and presents a short piece in which Pablo Picasso meets a beautiful woman.

results.title: Nobody waved good-bye
results.creator_credit: Don Owen, Roman Kroitor, Tom Daly and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A story of teenage conflict - the predicament of a youth who rebels against his parents’ middle-class goals and conventions. Away from home and high school he finds the world a cold place to go it alone. Ideals are no defence when the need dor money leads to shady practices. This feature film is a study of the sources of delinquency in an affluent society, mirroring many of the problems and frustrations of young people. Cast includes: Julie Biggs, Peter Kastner, Charmion King, Ron Taylor, John Vernon.

results.title: Ace Ventura: when nature calls (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Steve Oedekerk, James G. Robinson and Morgan Creek
results.brief_description: Jim Carrey again stars as Ace Ventura, the animal sleuth with the gravity-defying hairstyle in this sequel to ‘Ace Ventura, Pet Detective’ (309280). In the deepest jungles of Africa, two tribes will fight a savage war unless their sacred animal god is found. So they’re sending for the only man who can help. Africa will never be the same again as Ace discovers the animal within and answers the call of the wild in this out-there comedy! Cast includes Jim Carrey, Ian McNeice, Simon Callow, Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje and Maynard Eziashi.

results.title: Quiz show
results.creator_credit: Robert Redford, Julian Krainin, Michael Jacobs, Michael Nozik and Hollywood Pictures
results.brief_description: Ralph Fiennes and John Turturro play contestants battling for huge cash prizes and instant fame on a top-rated quiz show in the mid-1950s. When charges surface that the hit program is fixed and players are being given the answers, it becomes far more than a game. Contestants, producers and the network itself get caught in the centre of an escalating scandal. Nominated for the 1994 Best Picture Academy Award and based on a true story that shocked the United States, this is a very compelling film.

results.title: Grease
results.creator_credit: Randal Kleiser, Allan Carr, Robert Stigwood and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: John Travolta cemented his position as the most versatile magnetic screen presence of the decade in this film version of the smash hit Broadway musical of the same name. Recording star Olivia Newton-John made her American film debut as Sandy, Travolta’s naive love interest. The impressive supporting cast reads like a who’s who in this quintessential musical about the fabulous 50s. Grease is not just a nostalgic look at a simpler decade, its an energetic and exciting musical homage to the age of rock’n’roll. Grease is the word! Includes new, retrospective interviews with the creators and cast of the hit musical.

results.title: Brassed off
results.creator_credit: Mark Herman, Steve Abbot, Channel Four Films and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: The Grimethorpe Colliery Band doesn’t have much to play for these days with the shadow of the mine’s imminent closure looming over them. Danny (Pete Postlethwaite) doesn’t share this view, as band master he sees the band as the life blood of the community. His son has the opposite view, blaming the conservative Thatcher government for the community’s misfortune. The band receives a lift in spirits with the arrival of Gloria (Tara Fitzgerald), a fluglehorn player eager to join the band but unbeknown to them is also part of the “management” team making decisions about the mine. For Andy (Ewan McGregor), Gloria’s appearance sparks memories of their brief teenage romance. When the mine closes and Danny is placed into hospital, plans for competing in the National Championship are placed on hold. After a series of conflicts however the band discovers a way of venting their anger and telling their story as well as that of miners elsewhere. An enjoyable comedy with a serious message about economic policy and the mining community. Also starring Jim Carter, Phillip Jackson, Stephen Moore, Ken Colley and Peter Gunn.

results.title: The Full Monty
results.creator_credit: Peter Cattaneo, Uberto Pasolini and Redwave Productions
results.brief_description:
Robert Carlyle stars as Gaz in this irreverent comedy set in the middle-England working class town of Sheffield. He is a jobless steel worker who dreams up an outrageous scheme to pull himself and his mates out of the personal and financial doldrums of long term unemployment. After seeing the money and adulation lauded upon the male exotic dance team The Chippendales by the females of the town, he rounds up willing and reticent participants for a review to be named the Full Monty. They are a collection of pigeon-chested, pot-bellied, heavy drinking, pale, wrinkly middle-aged strippers with one solitary gimmick - it all comes off!
Cast also includes: Tom Wilkinson, Mark Addy

results.title: The People vs. Larry Flynt
results.creator_credit: Milos Forman, Janet Yang, Michael Hausman, Oliver Stone and Ixtlan
results.brief_description: This is the story of the rise and rise of a self-confessed “smut-peddler”, Larry Flynt (Woody Harrelson) and his wife Althea (Courtney Love) and his building of a publishing empire, of which “Hustler” magazine is the figurehead. Along the way Flynt gets dragged to court by several exponent of the religious right, intent on defending the “decent folks”. At every turn, Larry fights back, using a tactic of high antics and retreat behind the “First Amendment”. Courted by the Pentecostal movement and Ruth Carter (Jimmy’s sister) played by Donna Hannover, he finally converts, only to give his campaign for “free speech and porn for all” the overtones of a crusade. The true life story of Larry Flynt is rich in sex, drugs, making money - and an assassination attempt. Who is Larry Flynt: a hedonistic, obnoxious pornograph or or an unlikely freedom of speech campaigner whose ardour is only tamed by drug addiction, mental illness, and Althea’s failing health? This film won two Oscar nominations to Forman and Harrelson. Winner of Golden Bear, Berlin - 1997. Includes cameos by Larry Flynt, James Carville (former Clinton ‘91 campaing director) and Donna Hannover.

results.title: The Woman Suffers
results.creator_credit: Raymond Longford and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: This 1918 Australian feature is one of the most significant surviving treasures of a silent film heritage which is now largely extinct. The story takes the concept of primitive justice - an eye for an eye, a tooth for a tooth - and extends it to a sister for a sister. Ralph Manton discovers that his sister Marjory has been seduced and demands to be told the name of the man. Faithful to her lover, she refuses, but later Ralph discovers his identity and confronts him. The tables are turned. Starring Australia’s first film star, Lottie Lyell, the film was a critical and commercial success and offered audiences more than just a melodrama. It questioned the social mores of the day and the double standards of morality in regard to the men as the seducers. Musical accompaniment is by members of the Canberra Symphony Orchestra, conducted by composer Donald Hollier.

results.title: Uncivilised
results.brief_description: This is the story of Beatrice Lynn, a high society author, who heads into the wilds of northern Australia in search of an Aboriginal tribe ruled by a white king, Mara. Along the way she is kidnapped and taken through the bush, encountering pituri smugglers, and battling a killer before finally being sold to Mara. In the tradition of true melodramas a love conflict develops between the white chief and Beatrice and leads to an epic Chauvel finale. Filmed in North Queensland and Palm Island and featuring spectacular rainforest and river cinematography, director Chauvel made this film in an attempt to break into the American market. Censorship problems relating to nude swimming as well as violence were eventually overcome for the Australian release while a censored version was released on the overseas market.
